history.short_description: Arakkal Museum showcases the legacy of Kerala's only Muslim royal family — the Arakkal dynasty of Kannur.
history.detailed: The Arakkal Museum is part of the Arakkal Kettu Palace complex, the historic residence of the Arakkal Ali Rajas and Beevis — Kerala's only Muslim royal family. The Arakkal dynasty ruled parts of the Malabar coast and the Lakshadweep Islands for centuries, with strong influence over maritime trade. The museum displays royal artifacts including furniture, weapons, documents, coins, letters, household items, and intricate wooden architecture. The building reflects Kerala–Arab cultural influences. The Government of Kerala converted a section of the palace into a museum to preserve the royal family's history and maritime heritage.

significance.heritage: Important site representing the only Muslim royal lineage in Kerala.
significance.architecture: Features Kerala-style palace architecture with carvings and historical rooms.
significance.culture: Preserves maritime, political, and cultural history of the Arakkal family.
significance.tourism: One of Kannur's most educational and heritage-rich spots.
